channel.title: Blog on technocracy
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on technocracy

item.title: ButcherBox Brisket
item.description: Most of my brisket cuts are coming from ButcherBox these days and are under 5lbs instead of the typical 12lbs “full packer”.

item.title: Neural Networks are easy
item.description: Andrej Karpathy has posted some incredible content - one of the best explanations of backpropagation and the training of neural networks I’ve come across.

item.title: On Data Quality
item.description: At Interos, my team built a platform for assembling and maintaining the world’s business supply chains.

item.title: Granting a new user permissions on RDS Maria/Mysql
item.description: You cannot use GRANT ALL for any user on an Amazon AWS RDS instance of Mysql/Maria (Aurora Mysql).

item.description: Lucky me had the opportunity to review & adopt 60+ HITRUST policies for HealthPrize this week.

item.description: When setting up my latest development environment at AWS, I wanted to deploy all EC2 services on a private VPC and simply route all traffic to them through a Bastion host (aka jump host).

item.description: I recently setup a Bastion host to secure a development environment on AWS.

item.description: My last post was over a year and a half ago - just after I joined an interesting Bessemer Ventures backed firm in the Hospitality sector called Social Tables.
